body:
Hey guys, im getting a gaming pc soon, and building it, I want to know your opinions.

Specs -:
- Intel Core i7 3770K 3.50GHz (Ivy Bridge Socket 1155) £247.98
- Corsair XM53 8GB DDR3 1600MHz RAM £65.49
- Seagate 2TB Barracuda 3.5" SATA-III Hard Drive £60.99
- Titanium 500 ATX PC Gaming Case £22.98
- LG DVD Writer £15.99
- Nvidia 750Ti 2GB DDR5  HDMI PCI-E Graphics Card £114.99
- Arctic Cooling Freezer Heat Sink £15.06
- PowerCool X-Viper 750W Semi Modular 80+ Bronze Power Supply £52.98

Total: £596.46

Reply what you think :P

title: Gaming PC! Need Your Opinion

replies.body:
This all depends on what game(s) you're playing.  If it's MC only, I 'd recommend an AMD graphics card.  If you play other games, NVIDIA is the best choice.  The processor is good.  The hard drive will take a while to boot up your computer, so if you can get an SSD, that would be best.  Otherwise, it looks good to me.  

Calling DoctaPop for further review <3
replies.body_tagged:
This all depends on what game(s) you're playing.  If it's MC only, I 'd recommend an AMD graphics card.  If you play other games, NVIDIA is the best choice.  The processor is good.  The hard drive will take a while to boot up your computer, so if you can get an SSD, that would be best.  Otherwise, it looks good to me.  

Calling DoctaPop for further review <3

replies.body: Oh i forgot I'm partitioning the HDD and ill put the OS on one partition and I'm getting SSD Cache for start up.
replies.body_tagged: Oh i forgot I'm partitioning the HDD and ill put the OS on one partition and I'm getting SSD Cache for start up.

replies.body: And it's not just mc, I'll be using things like Battlefield and Saints Row etc.
replies.body_tagged: And it's not just mc, I'll be using things like Battlefield and Saints Row etc.

replies.body: I recommend an AMD graphics card, 1st they are better Than NVIDA (Most are) and second, They provide the BEST fps possible :)
replies.body_tagged: I recommend an AMD graphics card, 1st they are better Than NVIDA (Most are) and second, They provide the BEST fps possible :)

replies.body: I'm sorry but I totally disagree
replies.body_tagged: I'm sorry but I totally disagree

replies.body: Oh BattleField... Den use NVIDA.. Mah bad :)
replies.body_tagged: Oh BattleField... Den use NVIDA.. Mah bad :)

replies.body: http://www.nvidia.co.uk/gtx-700-graphics-cards/gtx-750ti/ - More info on my card, it's the GTX 750 Ti (Titan)
replies.body_tagged: http://www.nvidia.co.uk/gtx-700-graphics-cards/gtx-750ti/ - More info on my card, it's the GTX 750 Ti (Titan)

replies.body: You don't need an i7 for gaming, let alone one that is nearing 2 years old.
replies.body_tagged: You don't need an i7 for gaming, let alone one that is nearing 2 years old.

replies.body: I have an i3 and it runs well, there is no point getting and i7 unless you want to have it run even better, but it's up to you.
replies.body_tagged: I have an i3 and it runs well, there is no point getting and i7 unless you want to have it run even better, but it's up to you.

replies.body:
You should spend less on your CPU.

If you want to have a good gaming PC you have to spend more on your GPU unless MC is the only game you play and will ever play.

How does this look?

http://pcpartpicker.com/user/poptyler945/saved/LdZ9TW

replies.body:
You really don't need an i7 for gaming. An i5 would be enough if you are not going to do massive editing (if you will edit you should also get 16GB RAM).

You also should get an SSD.
replies.body_tagged:
You really don't need an i7 for gaming. An i5 would be enough if you are not going to do massive editing (if you will edit you should also get 16GB RAM).

You also should get an SSD.

replies.body: Sorry guys :P I have chosen an i7 purely because of the reliability, if i got an i5 i would have to upgrade within the next 2 year where as an i7 is more reliable and i will have to upgrade in 4 years and yes I will be doing a lot of editing
replies.body_tagged: Sorry guys :P I have chosen an i7 purely because of the reliability, if i got an i5 i would have to upgrade within the next 2 year where as an i7 is more reliable and i will have to upgrade in 4 years and yes I will be doing a lot of editing

replies.body: Just a minor note for after you finish the pc, get windows 7 instead of 8, its a minor note but will make a major difference while gaming, because it might not allow you to play certain games like generals zh
replies.body_tagged: Just a minor note for after you finish the pc, get windows 7 instead of 8, its a minor note but will make a major difference while gaming, because it might not allow you to play certain games like generals zh

replies.body: I'm getting Win 7 Ultimate :P Thanks anyway :)
replies.body_tagged: I'm getting Win 7 Ultimate :P Thanks anyway :)

replies.body:
i7 is the better choice if you do rendering and etc

But if you only plan on upgrading in 4 years.. I don't think a 750ti will suffice.
The gtx 980/970 and 960 are around the corner, I would wait if I were you, since the gtx 960 will most likely be very close, if not beat a (performance-wise)  gtx 770.

I'm waiting for the gtx 980 c;
And maybe if you went a spent a bit more, you could get a 970, which will most likely beat a 780.
